reviewText: I recently watched Benny & Joon and found this collection on here.  What could be better than a triple feature collection of Johnny Depp?  Nothing, that's what.  :-)  But, I found this too late.  I just recently went on a rampage through the flea market and ended up buying Edward Scissorhands and From Hell.Not that I'm really complaining, I mean, either way I would've gotten all of the movies.  But, I guess my point is that this is an amazing deal.Benny & Joon: A young mentally ill woman (Joon) is living with her brother (Benny) and, through a game of poker, end up being saddled with young Sam (Johnny Depp).  Sam is a strange young man who likes to dress and model after the silent film star Buster Keaton.  Sam and Joon fall in love and the siblings's relationship is tested when word gets out.Edward Scissorhands: Depp's true break-out role in movies and the first Depp/Burton collaboration.  An inventor who resides in a castle on top of a giant hill is working to create a human being. Before completion, however, the inventor dies and leaves the almost-complete Edward with scissors for hands.  He is discovered by a kind woman who resides in the town below and she takes him back home, to care for him.  He is welcomed, at first, but then things take a turn for the worst.From Hell: The year is 1888.  The place is London.  And Jack the Ripper is alive and well and going about his infamous buisness.  This movie takes a view of two inspectors from Scotland Yard as they attempt to solve the murder mystery that is still talked about, over 100 years in the future.Overall, I loved everyone of these movies and I think that if you are a fan of Johnny Depp and don't own at least 2 of these movies, this is something you must buy.

reviewText: Wow-I have always just had a single dvd pack. This 3 pack of Johnny Depp movies is fascinating. The first film, Benny & Joon is a nice family movie. Edward Scissorhands is a classic, From Hell is pretty creepy.Anyways, I enjoyed all the films and I would recommend this set.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Most Johnny Depp fans will already have most, if not all, of these films already. If, like me, you already own a few of these on videotape, this is an excellent excuse to upgrade to DVD. Contains the classic Tim Burton feature "Edward Scissorhands", the marvelous romantic comedy "Benny & Joon" and the terror-filled dramatization of Alan (Watchmen) Moore's "From Hell". A wide and sweeping selection of Depp's films, showing the breadth of his acting abilities in fantasy, drama and horror.
summary: Not just for Johnny Depp fans...
